message.content:
Research the available APIs and scripting capabilities in Adobe Premiere Pro for razor/editing operations. Focus on:
1. What scripting APIs exist for cutting/razoring clips in Premiere Pro?
2. How does the ExtendScript API handle timeline manipulation?
3. What objects and methods are available for clip operations (razor, trim, split)?
4. How do you access and manipulate sequences, tracks, and clip items programmatically?
5. What are the limitations of the current API for razor-type operations?

Research the Premiere Pro DOM (Document Object Model) for editing operations. This is research only - do not write code.

input.query: Adobe Premiere Pro ExtendScript API scripting documentation 2024 2025
Premiere Pro scripting API razor cut split clip programmatically
Premiere Pro DOM sequence track clipItem ExtendScript

Links: [{"title":"Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/"},{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"},{"title":"Overview - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/introduction/extendscript-overview/"},{"title":"Solved: Re: Create a premiere pro extension in 2023 - Adobe Product Community - 14099347","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/create-a-premiere-pro-extension-in-2023/m-p/14099881"},{"title":"Looking for any current Scripting Documentation / Resources for Premiere Pro","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/looking-for-any-current-scripting-documentation-resources-for-premiere-pro/m-p/14423678"},{"title":"Samples/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx at master · Adobe-CEP/Samples","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx"},{"title":"Using Adobe ExtendScript to Automate Video Editing in Premiere Pro","url":"https://metadesignsolutions.com/using-adobe-extendscript-to-automate-video-editing-in-premiere-pro/"},{"title":"Premiere Pro panels - Adobe-CEP/Samples","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/ReadMe.md"},{"title":"Where can I find documentation for ExtendScript for Premiere Pro?","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/where-can-i-find-documentation-for-extendscript-for-premiere-pro/td-p/10982745"},{"title":"Automate Premiere Pro with AI: ChatGPT and Extendscript","url":"https://vakago-tools.com/automate-premiere-pro-with-ai-chatgpt-and-extendscript/"}]

Here are the search results for Adobe Premiere Pro ExtendScript API scripting documentation for 2024-2025:

## Key Resources for Premiere Pro ExtendScript API

### Official Documentation
Premiere Pro provides an ExtendScript API, allowing for the access and manipulation of most project elements, including metadata, exporting and rendering options. The main documentation resource is available at **https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/**

### Important Update for 2025
As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so, through September 2026.(no content)The PProPanel was last updated November 2025, to coincide with the Premiere Pro 25.6 release, also known as "Premiere Pro 2025". As of Premiere Pro 25.6, CEP extensions to Premiere Pro have been superseded by UXP Extensibility.

### Sample Code & Development Resources
The PProPanel sample project is exhaustive in its exercise of Premiere Pro's ExtendScript API. It's available at: https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/tree/master/PProPanel

PProPanel, while very ugly, is thorough in demonstrating PPro's ExtendScript API. The project contains VSCode debugging configurations for JavaScript (the CEP layer) and ExtendScript (PPro's scripting API).

### Development Environment
ExtendScript Toolkit (ESTK) is no longer updated by Adobe; the recommended debugging environment for ExtendScript is Microsoft Visual Studio Code, with Adobe's ExtendScript debugging extension.(no content)Microsoft Visual Studio Code, and the ExtendScript debugging extension. This extension running in VSCode is Adobe's recommended ExtendScript development environment.

### Future of ExtendScript
No further changes or improvements to Premiere Pro's ExtendScript API are planned or scheduled. Any such changes will be reconsidered, once Premiere Pro moves to UXP-based extensibility.(no content)If you are starting new development, start in UXP. CEP extensions continue to be supported; the plan is to support both CEP and UXP for a calendar year, after which we will remove support for CEP extensibility.

### New UXP Resources
For new development, Adobe recommends:
- UXP samples: https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples/tree/main · Documentation: https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"},{"title":"Samples/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx at master · Adobe-CEP/Samples","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx"},{"title":"Solved: Editing clips with ExtendScript - Adobe Product Community - 9056625","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro/editing-clips-with-extendscript/td-p/9056625"},{"title":"ExtendScript: No longer able to add effects using QE DOM","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/extendscript-no-longer-able-to-add-effects-using-qe-dom/td-p/11353312"},{"title":"Enable/Disable a TrackItem object using ExtendScript?","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/enable-disable-a-trackitem-object-using-extendscript/m-p/8836739"},{"title":"ExtendScript Tutorial: Adding Effect to a Clip in Premiere Pro","url":"https://vakago-tools.com/extendscript-tutorial-adding-effect-to-a-clip-in-premiere-pro/"},{"title":"How to Nest a Sequence using ExtendScript in Premiere Pro","url":"https://vakago-tools.com/how-to-nest-a-sequence-using-extendscript-in-premiere-pro/"},{"title":"Where is detailed docs about Premiere Pro Scripting DOM API? · Issue #80 · Adobe-CEP/Samples","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/issues/80"},{"title":"[track].insertClip() & [track].overwriteClip() -- ... - Adobe Product Community - 10030777","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/track-insertclip-track-overwriteclip-quirks-questions/td-p/10030777"},{"title":"Having fun with the Active Sequence, Mute Tracks, Place Clips - PremiereOnScript","url":"https://premiereonscript.com/log-11/"}]

Based on my search, here's what I found about Premiere Pro DOM sequence, track, clipItem, and ExtendScript:

## Premiere Pro ExtendScript DOM Structure

### Sequence Access
The API provides access to objects and application settings within Premiere Pro. The single global object is always available by its name, `app`.

### Sequence Properties
An array of audio Track objects in the sequence is available as a TrackCollection object (read-only). The sequence also includes:
- The time, in ticks, of the end of the sequence (String; read-only)
- The horizontal frame size, or width, of the sequence. Set this attribute with the Sequence.setSettings() method (Integer; read-only)

### Working with Tracks and Clips
You can get the first clip in the timeline on video track 1 by using the `qe.project.getActiveSequence().getVideoTrackAt(0).getItemAt(0)` function. This returns the first item of the first video track in the active sequence.

### QE DOM vs Regular DOM
Officially, the QE DOM is not recommended, or supported. The QE DOM has some issues updating itself, in response to user interaction.(no content)There's no way to call getItemAt(x) that'll ignore empties; that's up to you. trackItems in the regular (non-QE) DOM have an isSelected() method.

### Track Methods
When using insertClip/overwriteClip, it doesn't seem to matter whether you choose the target sequence's videoTracks or audioTracks. Executing insertClip/overwriteClip always carries all picture and sound tracks from source clip to sequence.(no content)It does matter which track layer is chosen. Choosing videoTracks[0] or audioTracks[0] means a source clip with 1 picture track and 2 sound tracks will route to V1 and A1 / A2 on the record side. Choosing videoTracks[1]/audioTracks[1] means Source V1/A1/A2 will route to Sequence V2/A2/A3.

### Future of ExtendScript
No further changes or improvements to Premiere Pro's ExtendScript API are planned or scheduled. Any such changes will be reconsidered, once Premiere Pro moves to UXP-based extensibility.(no content)As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so, through September 2026.

### Recommended Resources
- The PProPanel sample exercises Premiere Pro's ExtendScript API: https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/tree/master/PProPanel.
- Official documentation at ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

## Premiere Pro ExtendScript DOM Structure

### Sequence Properties
An array of audio Track objects in the sequence is available as a TrackCollection object (read-only). The sequence also includes:

You can get the first clip in the timeline on video track 1 by using the `qe.project.getActiveSequence().getVideoTrackAt(0).getItemAt(0)` function. This returns the first item of the first video track in the active sequence.

content.content:
Web search results for query: "Premiere Pro scripting API razor cut split clip programmatically"

Links: [{"title":"How to split or cut clips in Premiere Pro","url":"https://helpx.adobe.com/premiere-pro/using/split-or-cut-clips.html"},{"title":"Solved: Perform a cut from script? - Adobe Product Community - 11389974","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/perform-a-cut-from-script/td-p/11389974"},{"title":"The 3 Easiest Ways to Cut Clips in Adobe Premiere Pro CC","url":"https://www.premiumbeat.com/blog/cut-clips-premiere-pro-tools/"},{"title":"Where is detailed docs about Premiere Pro Scripting DOM API? · Issue #80 · Adobe-CEP/Samples","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/issues/80"},{"title":"How to split a clip in Premiere Pro - Storyblocks","url":"https://www.storyblocks.com/resources/tutorials/how-to-split-a-clip-in-premiere-pro"},{"title":"Premiere Pro tutorial: Trimming clips on the Timeline in Premiere Pro","url":"https://www.agitraining.com/adobe/premiere-pro/tutorials/trimming-clips-on-the-timeline-in-premiere-pro"},{"title":"Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/"},{"title":"How to Split a Clip in Premiere Pro: An Easy Tutorial","url":"https://www.tourboxtech.com/en/news/how-to-split-a-clip-in-premiere-pro.html"},{"title":"Solved: ExtendScript: Split clip using insertClip method? - Adobe Product Community - 14432687","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/extendscript-split-clip-using-insertclip-method/m-p/14432687"},{"title":"Tutorial: Learn How to Split Clips in Adobe Premiere Pro - Motion Array","url":"https://motionarray.com/learn/premiere-pro/adobe-premiere-split-clips/"}]

Based on the search results, here's what I found about programmatically splitting/cutting clips in Premiere Pro using the scripting API:

## Key Findings

### No Direct Cut Function in ExtendScript API
There's no cut function in extendscript API.(no content)There's no such thing as a 'cut', in the API. Instead, you would adjust the duration of the existing trackItem, then insert a new trackItem, representing the remaining portion of the original trackItem.

### QE DOM Razor Method (Unsupported)
QE DOM has razor(string, bool, bool) method on sequence and track objects, but this is part of the unsupported QE DOM. You can accomplish that, without using the (unsupported, unrecommended) QE DOM.

There's a code example showing the QE DOM approach:
You can apply the cut to all audio tracks using a loop that gets each audio track and calls `audioTrack.razor(timecodeString, true)`.

### Recommended Workaround
You would create a new trackItem using everything you know (source projectItem, speed changes, footage reinterpretation) about the trackItem you're "cutting" (truncating).

The workaround involves:
1. Adjusting the end point of the original clip
2. Inserting a new clip representing the remaining portion

### API Documentation Resources
This reference is a public compendium of information about the methods and members available via the ExtendScript API. Premiere Pro's ExtendScript-based API allows for broad control of the entire application. ExtendScript can access and manipulate most project elements, including metadata, exporting and rendering options.(no content)As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP; Unified Extensibility Platform. ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, and the plan is for them to remain so, through September 2026.

### Sample Code Reference
Adobe provides sample code at: https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples - There's a reference to sample code at the Adobe-CEP/Samples repository on GitHub showing how to accomplish clip manipulation.

## Summary
To programmatically split a clip in Premiere Pro, you have two options:
1. **Use the QE DOM's `razor()` method** - Works but is unsupported/unrecommended
2. **Manually simulate a cut** - Adjust the existing trackItem's duration and insert a new trackItem for the remaining portion


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

input.prompt: Extract all information about the DOM structure, available objects (Sequence, Track, TrackItem, Clip), and methods for timeline manipulation, especially any cut/razor/split operations
Extract detailed information about TrackItem object, Track object, Sequence object - their properties and methods, especially related to clip manipulation, splitting, trimming, and razor operations

content.content:
# Premiere Pro ExtendScript API: DOM and Timeline Objects

Based on the documentation provided, here's what's available:

## Available Objects

The guide documents several key objects for timeline manipulation:

- **Sequence object** - represents a timeline/sequence
- **Track object** - represents individual tracks within a sequence
- **TrackItem object** - represents clips/items placed on tracks
- **Component object** - represents effects/components applied to items
- **ProjectItem object** - represents media in the project

## Collections

These objects are accessed through collections:
- TrackCollection, TrackItemCollection, SequenceCollection, ComponentCollection, ProjectItemCollection

## Key Limitation

The documentation page content provided is primarily a **navigation index and introduction**. The actual method details for cut/razor/split operations are not included in this excerpt. The guide states: "This reference is a public compendium of information about the methods and members available via the ExtendScript API."

## To Find Specific Methods

You would need to navigate to the individual object pages (e.g., `/sequence/trackitem/` or `/sequence/track/`) in the full documentation to see specific methods for timeline manipulation, which aren't detailed in this homepage content.

## Important Note

The guide indicates "ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported...through September 2026," with migration to UXP recommended going forward.

content.content:
# TrackItem, Track, and Sequence Objects in Premiere Pro ExtendScript

## TrackItem Object
TrackItem represents a clip on a video or audio track within a sequence.

**Key Properties:**
- `start`/`end`: Visible time in sequence (relative to sequence beginning)
- `inPoint`/`outPoint`: Source in/out points
- `duration`: Clip length (read-only)
- `projectItem`: Source media reference
- `components`: Associated effects and transformations
- `disabled`: Enable/disable state (read/write)

**Notable Methods:**
- `remove(inRipple, inAlignToVideo)`: "Sets the selection state of the trackItem" with ripple option
- `move(newInPoint)`: Shifts clip by specified time
- `getSpeed()`: Returns speed multiplier
- `isSpeedReversed()`: Checks reversal state
- `setSelected(state, updateUI)`: Selection management

## Track Object
Track represents a video or audio channel in a sequence.

**Properties:**
- `clips`: TrackItemCollection (read-only)
- `mediaType`: "Audio" or "Video"
- `transitions`: Transition collection
- `name`, `id`: Track identification

**Methods:**
- `insertClip(projectItem, time, vTrackIndex, aTrackIndex)`: Insert media
- `overwriteClip(projectItem, time)`: Insert with overwrite
- `isMuted()`, `setMute()`: Mute control

## Sequence Object
Sequence represents a timeline containing tracks and media.

**Key Properties:**
- `videoTracks`/`audioTracks`: Track collections
- `markers`: MarkerCollection
- `zeroPoint`: Starting time
- `frameSizeHorizontal`/`frameSizeVertical`: Dimensions

**Manipulation Methods:**
- `insertClip()`: Add clip at specified time
- `overwriteClip()`: Insert with overwrite
- `getSelection()`: "An array of Track item objects, of the selected clips"
- `createSubsequence()`: Extract in/out range as nested sequence
- `setPlayerPosition()`: Move CTI
- `setInPoint()`/`setOutPoint()`: Define work area

**Note:** The documentation lacks explicit "razor" or "split" methods—clip manipulation occurs through removal and reinsertion.

toolUseResult.result:
# TrackItem, Track, and Sequence Objects in Premiere Pro ExtendScript

## TrackItem Object
TrackItem represents a clip on a video or audio track within a sequence.

**Key Properties:**
- `start`/`end`: Visible time in sequence (relative to sequence beginning)
- `inPoint`/`outPoint`: Source in/out points
- `duration`: Clip length (read-only)
- `projectItem`: Source media reference
- `components`: Associated effects and transformations
- `disabled`: Enable/disable state (read/write)

**Notable Methods:**
- `remove(inRipple, inAlignToVideo)`: "Sets the selection state of the trackItem" with ripple option
- `move(newInPoint)`: Shifts clip by specified time
- `getSpeed()`: Returns speed multiplier
- `isSpeedReversed()`: Checks reversal state
- `setSelected(state, updateUI)`: Selection management

## Track Object
Track represents a video or audio channel in a sequence.

**Properties:**
- `clips`: TrackItemCollection (read-only)
- `mediaType`: "Audio" or "Video"
- `transitions`: Transition collection
- `name`, `id`: Track identification

**Methods:**
- `insertClip(projectItem, time, vTrackIndex, aTrackIndex)`: Insert media
- `overwriteClip(projectItem, time)`: Insert with overwrite
- `isMuted()`, `setMute()`: Mute control

## Sequence Object
Sequence represents a timeline containing tracks and media.

**Key Properties:**
- `videoTracks`/`audioTracks`: Track collections
- `markers`: MarkerCollection
- `zeroPoint`: Starting time
- `frameSizeHorizontal`/`frameSizeVertical`: Dimensions

**Manipulation Methods:**
- `insertClip()`: Add clip at specified time
- `overwriteClip()`: Insert with overwrite
- `getSelection()`: "An array of Track item objects, of the selected clips"
- `createSubsequence()`: Extract in/out range as nested sequence
- `setPlayerPosition()`: Move CTI
- `setInPoint()`/`setOutPoint()`: Define work area

**Note:** The documentation lacks explicit "razor" or "split" methods—clip manipulation occurs through removal and reinsertion.

Links: [{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"},{"title":"Solved: Editing clips with ExtendScript - Adobe Product Community - 9056625","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro/editing-clips-with-extendscript/td-p/9056625"},{"title":"Samples/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx at master · Adobe-CEP/Samples","url":"https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx"},{"title":"Sequence object - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/sequence/sequence/"},{"title":"Scripting bug when setInPoint and setOutPoint? - Adobe Premiere Pro - Creative COW","url":"https://creativecow.net/forums/thread/scripting-bug-when-setinpoint-and-setoutpointae/"},{"title":"How to Nest a Sequence using ExtendScript in Premiere Pro","url":"https://vakago-tools.com/how-to-nest-a-sequence-using-extendscript-in-premiere-pro/"},{"title":"Premiere Pro Scripting: Set In and Out Points of Clip","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro/premiere-pro-scripting-set-in-and-out-points-of-clip/m-p/10490225"},{"title":"Solved: Perform a cut from script? - Adobe Product Community - 11389974","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/perform-a-cut-from-script/td-p/11389974"},{"title":"Solved: Premiere Pro Scripting ExtendScript question - Adobe Product Community - 13379442","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/premiere-pro-scripting-extendscript-question/td-p/13379442"},{"title":"Solved: Selected clip in timeline? - Adobe Product Community - 8233928","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/selected-clip-in-timeline/td-p/8233928"}]

Based on my search, here's what I found about working with TrackItem in/out points and trimming clips in Premiere Pro ExtendScript:

## TrackItem Properties for Trimming

The TrackItem object represents an item on a video or audio track, within a Sequence object.

### Key Properties:

**inPoint and outPoint (source-relative):**
- The in point set on the source for this trackItem instance, relative to the beginning of the source. Time object, read/write.
- The out point set on the source for this TrackItem instance, relative to the beginning of the source. Time object, read/write.

**start and end (sequence-relative):**
- The visible end time of the trackItem in the sequence, relative to the beginning of its corresponding sequence (NOT the sequence zero point). This may differ from the trackItem's out point, which is relative to the source. Time object, read/write.
- The visible start time of the trackItem in the sequence, relative to the beginning of its corresponding sequence (NOT the sequence zero point). Note: This may differ from the trackItem's in point, which is relative to the source. Time object, read/write.

## Important Limitations

Changes to inPoint don't seem to travel along when inserting clips from project. It seems that setInPoint() is not a function to be used with videoTracks.clips.(no content)There's no cut function; you'd need to change the end point of the trackItem (clip).(no content)As a workaround you can use overwriteClip() with one-frame media and then delete that new media immediately. Another workaround is adjusting inPoint, outPoint, start and end, but it is a bit tricky: clip's inPoint and outPoint work in a strange nonobvious way, so make tests first.

## Working Code Example

To adjust clip end points:
```javascript
var myClip = app.project.sequences[0].videoTracks[0].clips[0];
if (myClip){
    var oldEnd = myClip.end;
    if (oldEnd){
        oldEnd.seconds = oldEnd.seconds + 3;
        myClip.end = oldEnd;
    }
}
```

## For ProjectItems (Not TrackItems)

setInPoint() and setOutPoint() work on project items in CC 2019, but not in CC 2017 (it appears setInPoint() and setOutPoint() don't exist for a project item in CC 2017).(no content)When using projectItem.setInPoint(seconds) and projectItem.setOutPoint(seconds), about 50% of the time the I/O points (in the source window) are set with a 1 frame error.

## Sequence In/Out Points

For sequences, you can use `setInPoint()` and `setOutPoint()` directly on the sequence object, as shown in the nesting examples from the documentation and sample code.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Based on my search, here's what I found about the Premiere Pro QE DOM razor method for sequence tracks:

## Key Findings

### QE DOM is Unsupported
"The QE DOM remains unsupported, and not recommended." This is a consistent message from Adobe employees across multiple community threads.

QE (Quality Engineering) is a hidden, undocumented API for Premiere Pro. It is used by Adobe to run automated tests for development purposes. Although it is not officially supported by Adobe, it is usable alongside the official API.

### Using the Razor Method
Users can use Premiere's QE API to cut tracks using code like: `qe.project.getActiveSequence().getVideoTrackAt(0).razor(mytimecode);` and `qe.project.getActiveSequence().getAudioTrackAt(0).razor(mytimecode);`(no content)To use the razor method, you need to enable QE first with `app.enableQE();`, then get the active QE sequence, and use the player time in timecode format like "00:00:03:38". The razor method can be called on a track (`sqe.getVideoTrackAt(0).razor(playerTime)`) to cut only on that track, or on the sequence (`sqe.razor(playerTime)`) to cut on all tracks.

### Known Issues
When using the QE razor method on individual tracks, this unlinks the audio and video tracks. Users have asked if there's a method to re-link the tracks.

### Workaround for Re-linking
A workaround involves using the vanilla DOM to re-link clips after using QE razor: selecting clips with `setSelected(true, true)`, calling `sequence.linkSelection()`, then deselecting.

### Incompatibility Between DOMs
The QE DOM remains unsupported. Anything returned from the 'vanilla' DOM (like the trackItems returned by `app.project.activeSequence.getSelection()`), should be presumed to be incompatible with the QE DOM.

### No Official Trimming API
There is no supported Trimming API, but you can change the sequence in/out points of trackItems and move them.(no content)No additional work is planned on the unsupported, undocumented Premiere Pro ExtendScript QE DOM.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

## Key Findings

### QE DOM is Unsupported
"The QE DOM remains unsupported, and not recommended." This is a consistent message from Adobe employees across multiple community threads.

Users can use Premiere's QE API to cut tracks using code like: `qe.project.getActiveSequence().getVideoTrackAt(0).razor(mytimecode);` and `qe.project.getActiveSequence().getAudioTrackAt(0).razor(mytimecode);`(no content)To use the razor method, you need to enable QE first with `app.enableQE();`, then get the active QE sequence, and use the player time in timecode format like "00:00:03:38". The razor method can be called on a track (`sqe.getVideoTrackAt(0).razor(playerTime)`) to cut only on that track, or on the sequence (`sqe.razor(playerTime)`) to cut on all tracks.

Links: [{"title":"Request for Timeline Editing API Support (Clip Tra... - Adobe Product Community - 15624626","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-ideas/request-for-timeline-editing-api-support-clip-track-movement-flattening/idc-p/15625115"},{"title":"The Premiere UXP API","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/"},{"title":"How to Add Clips to a Sequence Using Premiere Pro UXP API? - Premiere Pro - Adobe Creative Cloud Developer Forums","url":"https://forums.creativeclouddeveloper.com/t/how-to-add-clips-to-a-sequence-using-premiere-pro-uxp-api/8977"},{"title":"Offline Docs - Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/"},{"title":"Solved: how to insertClip in UXP plugin - Adobe Product Community - 15097904","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/how-to-insertclip-in-uxp-plugin/td-p/15097904"},{"title":"UXP: How to read clip markers and cut timeline ite... - Adobe Product Community - 15510061","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/uxp-how-to-read-clip-markers-and-cut-timeline-items-at-those-positions/td-p/15510061"},{"title":"Premiere API","url":"https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/ppro_reference/"},{"title":"GitHub - AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples","url":"https://github.com/AdobeDocs/uxp-premiere-pro-samples"},{"title":"Premiere Pro Scripting Guide","url":"https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/"},{"title":"Solved: UXP: Razor tool and marking clipped sections - Adobe Product Community - 15547922","url":"https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/uxp-razor-tool-and-marking-clipped-sections/td-p/15547922"}]

Based on my search, here's what I found about Premiere Pro UXP API timeline manipulation, cutting, and splitting clips in 2025:

## Current State of UXP API for Timeline Manipulation

As of November 2025, Premiere Pro has moved to extensibility based on UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform). ExtendScript-based integrations are still supported, with plans for them to remain so through September 2026.

### Key Limitations for Cutting/Splitting Clips

There is not yet any UXP API that mimics the razor tool. This is a significant limitation for developers looking to programmatically cut or split clips on the timeline.

UXP in Premiere Pro is in beta and very new, so lots of APIs haven't been built yet.(no content)If you need a production panel today or in the near future, you're going to need to build it in CEP.

### What IS Available in UXP

UXP (Unified eXtensibility Platform) is an integration framework built into Premiere and other Adobe Creative Cloud applications. It is powered by a modern JavaScript engine and offers the ability to access many Premiere functions at a programmatic level.(no content)An important difference between ExtendScript (and CEP) and UXP in Premiere is that all ExtendScript calls to Premiere were synchronous, blocking the Premiere UI while executing. In UXP, method calls are asynchronous and do not block the UI thread. For a smooth transition, all properties (get and set) in the API were designed to be synchronous and do not need to be awaited.(no content)The 'premiere_api' UXP example plugin shows how to clone and remove track items.(no content)Placing trackItems in a sequence is supported in both CEP+ExtendScript and UXP.

### Track Movement Limitations

There is no current API method (DOM, QE, CEP, or UXP) that can move an existing clip vertically between tracks.

### Resources

- The Premiere Pro UXP API documentation is available at https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/.
- Sample plugins and instructions for developing UXP plugins are available on GitHub.

### Recommendation

For timeline manipulation features like cutting and splitting clips that aren't yet available in UXP, developers currently need to rely on CEP with ExtendScript, which will remain supported through September 2026 according to Adobe's timeline.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.content:
# UXP Timeline Cutting and Clip Markers

Based on the Adobe Community forum thread provided, here's what I found regarding cutting timeline items in UXP:

## The Core Issue

The user is developing a UXP panel for Premiere Pro and wants to automate cuts on the timeline based on clip markers. However, they've encountered a fundamental limitation.

## Key Finding

**Adobe's Response:** Bruce Bullis from Adobe clarified that "PPro has no concept of 'clip-instance markers'; there are only sequence markers, or source markers."

This is the critical constraint: UXP developers cannot directly access or manipulate clip-instance markers on timeline clips themselves—only sequence-level or source media markers are available through the API.

## Workaround Implications

To work with the user's workflow (marking takes with \_ShotMark1 and \_ShotMark2), you would need to:

1. **Use sequence markers instead** - Place markers at the sequence level rather than on individual clips
2. **Access source markers** - Work with markers embedded in the source media files before they're placed on the timeline
3. **Explore ExtendScript** - The forum suggests UXP may have limitations here; ExtendScript (the older scripting method) might offer more timeline manipulation capabilities

The thread doesn't provide specific code examples or detailed workarounds for timeline splitting in UXP, indicating this remains an open technical challenge in the Adobe ecosystem.

input.prompt: Extract information about razor tool API, cutting clips programmatically, and any workarounds or limitations
Extract detailed information about QE API, razor method, enabling QE, and any available methods for cutting/splitting clips

content.content:
# Adobe Premiere Pro QE API Overview

## What is the QE API?

The QE API (Quality Engineering API) is an unofficial but widely-used toolkit originally built for Adobe's internal testing. Though technically unsupported, it provides critical capabilities absent from the official Premiere Pro API, such as applying video effects to clips.

## Enabling QE

To access QE functionality, developers must first call `app.enableQE()` before invoking any QE DOM functions like `qe.newProject()`.

## Key Available Methods

According to the ExtendScript Developer Tools documentation, the QE class includes:

- **Project operations:** `newProject()`, `resetProject()`, `open()`
- **Playback control:** `startPlayback()`, `stopPlayback()`
- **Effect management:** `getVideoEffectList()`, `getVideoEffectByName()`
- **Undo functionality:** `qe.project.undo()` (unavailable in official API)

## Inspecting Methods

The `qe.reflect.methods` property lists available functions. Tools like the ExtendScript Developer Tools can automate discovery, displaying method signatures, parameters, and return types through reflection.

## Practical Example

```javascript
app.enableQE();
var effect = qe.project.getVideoEffectByName("Gamma Correction");
var clip = qe.project.getActiveSequence()
  .getVideoTrackAt(0).getItemAt(1);
clip.addVideoEffect(effect);
```

**Note:** The provided content doesn't detail clip-splitting methods specifically.

toolUseResult.result:
# Adobe Premiere Pro QE API Overview

## What is the QE API?

The QE API (Quality Engineering API) is an unofficial but widely-used toolkit originally built for Adobe's internal testing. Though technically unsupported, it provides critical capabilities absent from the official Premiere Pro API, such as applying video effects to clips.

## Enabling QE

To access QE functionality, developers must first call `app.enableQE()` before invoking any QE DOM functions like `qe.newProject()`.

## Key Available Methods

According to the ExtendScript Developer Tools documentation, the QE class includes:

- **Project operations:** `newProject()`, `resetProject()`, `open()`
- **Playback control:** `startPlayback()`, `stopPlayback()`
- **Effect management:** `getVideoEffectList()`, `getVideoEffectByName()`
- **Undo functionality:** `qe.project.undo()` (unavailable in official API)

## Inspecting Methods

The `qe.reflect.methods` property lists available functions. Tools like the ExtendScript Developer Tools can automate discovery, displaying method signatures, parameters, and return types through reflection.

## Practical Example

```javascript
app.enableQE();
var effect = qe.project.getVideoEffectByName("Gamma Correction");
var clip = qe.project.getActiveSequence()
  .getVideoTrackAt(0).getItemAt(1);
clip.addVideoEffect(effect);
```

**Note:** The provided content doesn't detail clip-splitting methods specifically.

content.content:
# Razor Tool and Clipped Sections in Premiere Pro UXP

Based on the Adobe Community discussion, here's what developers need to know:

## Current API Limitations

According to an Adobe Employee response, **"There is not yet any UXP API that mimics the razor tool."** This is a significant constraint for plugin developers.

## Related Functionality Available

While direct razor tool support doesn't exist, UXP does support:

- **Sequence manipulation**: Placing track items in sequences works without issues
- **Export capabilities**: SRT file export is possible using output presets (.epr files)
- **Metadata access**: Video metadata including dimensions can be extracted from project items

## Marker and Metadata Constraints

An important limitation: markers attached to track items are actually stored at the project item level, not individually per clip. This means **different markers cannot be assigned to separate timeline sections** of the same source material.

## Recommended Approach

For razor tool functionality, developers should consider **CEP (ExtendScript)** as a fallback, though the same marker limitations would apply. The workaround involves managing clip segments through sequence-level operations rather than source editing.

This represents a genuine gap in the current UXP API that may require future Adobe updates to address comprehensively.

toolUseResult.result:
# Razor Tool and Clipped Sections in Premiere Pro UXP

Based on the Adobe Community discussion, here's what developers need to know:

## Current API Limitations

According to an Adobe Employee response, **"There is not yet any UXP API that mimics the razor tool."** This is a significant constraint for plugin developers.

## Related Functionality Available

While direct razor tool support doesn't exist, UXP does support:

- **Sequence manipulation**: Placing track items in sequences works without issues
- **Export capabilities**: SRT file export is possible using output presets (.epr files)
- **Metadata access**: Video metadata including dimensions can be extracted from project items

## Marker and Metadata Constraints

An important limitation: markers attached to track items are actually stored at the project item level, not individually per clip. This means **different markers cannot be assigned to separate timeline sections** of the same source material.

## Recommended Approach

For razor tool functionality, developers should consider **CEP (ExtendScript)** as a fallback, though the same marker limitations would apply. The workaround involves managing clip segments through sequence-level operations rather than source editing.

This represents a genuine gap in the current UXP API that may require future Adobe updates to address comprehensively.

input.prompt: Extract the full discussion about performing cuts from script, including any code examples, workarounds, and Adobe employee responses about razor functionality

content.text:
Based on my research, here is a comprehensive summary of Adobe Premiere Pro's scripting APIs for razor/editing operations.

---

## Adobe Premiere Pro Scripting APIs for Razor/Editing Operations

### 1. Available Scripting APIs

**Two main APIs exist:**

- **ExtendScript API (Official, Supported)** - The documented, official scripting API for Premiere Pro. Provides access to project elements, sequences, tracks, and track items.
- **QE DOM (Quality Engineering DOM) - Unsupported** - An internal Adobe testing API that exposes additional functionality including razor operations. Officially unsupported and undocumented, with no planned updates.

**Important timeline:** ExtendScript/CEP support will continue through September 2026. Adobe is transitioning to UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform), but UXP does not yet have razor tool functionality.

---

### 2. ExtendScript API Timeline Manipulation

**Key Objects:**

| Object | Description |
|--------|-------------|
| `app.project.activeSequence` | Access the currently active sequence |
| `Sequence.videoTracks` / `Sequence.audioTracks` | TrackCollection objects containing tracks |
| `Track.clips` | TrackItemCollection containing clips on a track |
| `TrackItem` | Individual clip on a track |

**TrackItem Properties (read/write):**
- `start` / `end` - Visible time in sequence (sequence-relative)
- `inPoint` / `outPoint` - Source in/out points (source-relative)
- `duration` - Clip length (read-only)
- `projectItem` - Reference to source media

**Track Methods:**
- `insertClip(projectItem, time, vTrackIndex, aTrackIndex)` - Insert media at specified time
- `overwriteClip(projectItem, time)` - Insert with overwrite mode

**Sequence Methods:**
- `getSelection()` - Returns array of selected TrackItem objects
- `setInPoint()` / `setOutPoint()` - Set work area
- `createSubsequence()` - Extract in/out range as nested sequence

---

### 3. Clip Operations: Razor, Trim, Split

**Critical Limitation: No native cut/razor function exists in the official ExtendScript API.**

**Workaround for simulating a cut:**
1. Adjust the `end` property of the existing TrackItem to truncate it
2. Insert a new TrackItem representing the remaining portion using `insertClip()`

**Example of adjusting clip endpoints:**
```javascript
var myClip = app.project.sequences[0].videoTracks[0].clips[0];
if (myClip) {
    var oldEnd = myClip.end;
    if (oldEnd) {
        oldEnd.seconds = oldEnd.seconds - 1; // Trim 1 second
        myClip.end = oldEnd;
    }
}
```

**QE DOM Razor Method (Unsupported):**
```javascript
app.enableQE();
var sqe = qe.project.getActiveSequence();
var playerTime = sqe.CTI.timecode; // Format: "00:00:03:38"

// Cut on specific track
sqe.getVideoTrackAt(0).razor(playerTime);

// Or cut on all tracks at sequence level
sqe.razor(playerTime);
```

---

### 4. Accessing Sequences, Tracks, and Clips Programmatically

**Sequence Access:**
```javascript
var activeSeq = app.project.activeSequence;
var allSequences = app.project.sequences; // SequenceCollection
```

**Track Access:**
```javascript
var videoTracks = activeSeq.videoTracks; // TrackCollection
var audioTracks = activeSeq.audioTracks;
var firstVideoTrack = videoTracks[0];
```

**Clip/TrackItem Access:**
```javascript
var clips = firstVideoTrack.clips; // TrackItemCollection
var firstClip = clips[0]; // TrackItem
```

**QE DOM Access (different structure):**
```javascript
app.enableQE();
var qeSeq = qe.project.getActiveSequence();
var qeVideoTrack = qeSeq.getVideoTrackAt(0);
var qeClip = qeVideoTrack.getItemAt(0);
```

**Note:** Objects from the vanilla DOM and QE DOM are incompatible with each other.

---

### 5. API Limitations for Razor-Type Operations

| Limitation | Details |
|------------|---------|
| **No native cut/razor in official API** | Must manually adjust clip endpoints and insert new clips |
| **QE DOM is unsupported** | The `razor()` method exists but is undocumented, unsupported, and may break |
| **QE razor unlinks clips** | Using QE razor on individual tracks unlinks audio/video; requires manual re-linking |
| **No vertical track movement** | Cannot move existing clips between tracks programmatically |
| **No trimming API** | Must manipulate `start`, `end`, `inPoint`, `outPoint` properties directly |
| **inPoint/outPoint behavior** | These properties behave non-obviously; testing is required |
| **UXP lacks razor support** | The new UXP API does not yet have any razor tool equivalent |
| **1-frame timing errors** | Setting in/out points sometimes produces 1-frame errors |
| **QE DOM update issues** | QE DOM has problems updating itself in response to user interaction |

---

### Summary

For razor/split operations in Premiere Pro:

1. **Official API:** No direct razor function. Simulate by adjusting `end` property and inserting new clips.
2. **QE DOM:** Has `razor(timecodeString)` method on sequences and tracks, but is officially unsupported.
3. **UXP (Future):** Does not yet support razor operations; developers needing this functionality should use CEP/ExtendScript for now.

---

**Sources:**
- [Premiere Pro Scripting Guide](https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/)
- [Premiere Pro Scripting Guide - Full Documentation](https://ppro-scripting.docsforadobe.dev/print_page/)
- [Adobe CEP Samples - PProPanel](https://github.com/Adobe-CEP/Samples/blob/master/PProPanel/jsx/PPRO/Premiere.jsx)
- [Perform a Cut from Script - Adobe Community](https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/perform-a-cut-from-script/td-p/11389974)
- [QE Razor, Link Clips - Adobe Community](https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/qe-razor-link-clips/td-p/14848454)
- [Understanding the Adobe Premiere Pro QE API - Vakago Tools](https://vakago-tools.com/premiere-pro-qe-api/)
- [UXP Razor Tool Discussion - Adobe Community](https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/uxp-razor-tool-and-marking-clipped-sections/td-p/15547922)
- [Premiere Pro UXP API Documentation](https://developer.adobe.com/premiere-pro/uxp/)
- [Premiere Pro Scripting ExtendScript Question - Adobe Community](https://community.adobe.com/t5/premiere-pro-discussions/premiere-pro-scripting-extendscript-question/td-p/13379442)
